meanings.sent1: She picked out her favorite duddie for the party.
meanings.sent2: His duddie was a mix of colors and patterns.
meanings.sent3: The duddie she wore to the event was a real showstopper.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the duddie symbolized the character's transformation.
meanings.sent5: The duddie he wore was so unique, everyone remembered it.

meanings.sent1: He likes to duddie up in his best clothes for special occasions.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, she takes her time to duddie before leaving the house.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to duddie themselves in funny costumes for the school play.
meanings.sent4: She knew she had to duddie herself in courage to face the challenge.
meanings.sent5: Before the performance, the actors would duddie in their elaborate costumes.

meanings.definition: A piece of clothing, especially a worn or ragged garment.
meanings.sent1: He found a cozy duddie at the thrift store.
meanings.sent2: The duddie she wore was a hand-me-down from her older sister.
meanings.sent3: Despite being a duddie, the sweater was surprisingly warm.
meanings.sent4: The duddie he wore had seen better days, but he loved it nonetheless.
meanings.sent5: She cherished the old duddie for its sentimental value.
